alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 1:33PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado River near Cisco affecting Grand County. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of heavy rain falling on a deep snowpack upstream will lead to an increase in runoff from snowmelt. Flow in the Colorado River will continue to increase through the end of the week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Colorado River near Cisco. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...Forecast hydrographs oscillate flow along the Colorado between 36,000 to 37,000 cfs upstream the confluence with the Dolores. Then, ramp up to 44,000 cfs below the confluence by Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 15.9 feet Saturday afternoon. - Action stage is 13.3 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Colorado River Cisco 19.0 12.8 Mon 11 am MD 13.5 14.0 14.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
